meanings.sent1: She retimes the clock every week to make sure it is accurate.
meanings.sent2: He retimes his running schedule to improve his speed.
meanings.sent3: The teacher retimes the students' reading speed for fun.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic retimes the engine to make it run smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The chef retimes the cooking process to perfection.

meanings.definition: To adjust the timing of something.
meanings.sent1: He retimes the sprinklers to water the garden more efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She retimes the music playlist for the party.
meanings.sent3: The magician retimes his tricks for a surprising show.
meanings.sent4: The conductor retimes the orchestra to create harmony.
meanings.sent5: The coach retimes the players' strategies for success.

meanings.sent1: The retimes of the race were necessary due to a technical issue.
meanings.sent2: The retimes of the experiments revealed consistent results.
meanings.sent3: The retimes of the clock made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The retimes of history show how events can change perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The retimes of the play added suspense to the performance.
